methods.name: format
methods.description:
The format string follows the IEEE printf specification.

For each "conversion specification" (ie. %s for a string or %d for a number) used inside the string, formatString argument, the respective value is substituted from the argument list. For example:

var forename = 'Paul';
var number = 21;
var message = String.format('Welcome, %s! You are visitor number %d', forename, number);
Ti.API.info(message);

parameters.name: formatString
parameters.summary: An IEEE printf-style string, containing zero or more conversion specifications.

parameters.name: value
parameters.summary: Values to substitute into the formatString. The method expects a variable number of value arguments, one for each % conversion specification in the format string. Optional on Android.

methods.name: formatCurrency
methods.summary: Formats a number into the currency format, including currency symbol, of the locale configured for the system.

methods.name: formatDate
methods.summary: Formats a date into the date format of the locale configured for the system.

parameters.name: format
parameters.summary: Date format to use. One of 'short', 'medium', 'long' or 'full'.

methods.name: formatDecimal
methods.summary: Formats a number into the decimal format, including decimal symbol, of the locale configured for the system.
methods.description: The localized string created by this method can be parsed be parsed back to a number via the parseDecimal method.

parameters.name: locale
parameters.summary: Locale string. For example, en-US for US English.

returns.summary: String representation of the specified number, using a locale-specific decimal symbol, if required.

methods.name: formatTime
methods.summary: Formats a date into the time format of the locale configured for the system.
methods.description: On Android, this method returns the short format.

parameters.name: format
parameters.summary: Date format to use. One of 'short', 'medium', or 'long' (iOS only.)
